How to Install libforks-perl on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libforks-perl

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libforks-perl on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libforks-perl on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libforks-perl in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libforks-perl, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libforks-perl Using apt

To install libforks-perl in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libforks-perl using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libforks-perl

The installation of libforks-perl might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libforks-perl Using apt-get

To install libforks-perl using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libforks-perl.

sudo apt-get -y install libforks-perl

Install libforks-perl Using Synaptic

To install libforks-perl using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libforks-perl on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libforks-perl. This will display the libforks-perl package in the package window, now to install libforks-perl, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libforks-perl package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libforks-perl.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libforks-perl Using aptitude

To install libforks-perl on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libforks-perl.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libforks-perl using the command aptitude install libforks-perl.

sudo aptitude -y install libforks-perl

How to Upgrade libforks-perl on debian

If you want to upgrade the libforks-perl package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libforks-perl using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libforks-perl to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libforks-perl.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libforks-perl sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libforks-perl

Upgrade libforks-perl using Aptitude

To upgrade libforks-perl using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libforks-perl.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libforks-perl

Upgrade libforks-perl using Synaptic

To upgrade libforks-perl using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libforks-perl, now right-click libforks-perl, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libforks-perl just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libforks-perl on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libforks-perl from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libforks-perl, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libforks-perl

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libforks-perl

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libforks-perl you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libforks-perl

Remove libforks-perl using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libforks-perl using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libforks-perl, right-click the libforks-perl package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libforks-perl click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libforks-perl on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libforks-perl using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libforks-perl then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
